Detailed Description

Definition at line 19 of file Facade.h.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef boost::function<void( Facade_ptr facade, Session_ptr session, event::Event_ptr event)> sevent::socket::Facade::allEventsHandler_t

Events are sent to a callback of this type defined in setWorkerThreads().

Warning:
The data-buffer in ReceiveEvent::data() is not freed automatically, so it is up to the handler to make sure no memory leaks occur (by calling delete[] event.data()).

virtual Session_ptr sevent::socket::Facade::connect ( Address_ptr  address) [pure virtual]

Create a session with the Listener at the given address.

Blocks until a connection is established.

Exceptions:
std::runtime_errorIf connecting to the given address fails.

virtual void sevent::socket::Facade::joinAllWorkerThreads ( ) [pure virtual]

Block until all workerthreads are finished.

Use service()->stop() (from another thread) to stop the Service.

Implemented in sevent::asiosocket::AsioFacade.

virtual Listener_ptr sevent::socket::Facade::listen ( Address_ptr  address) [pure virtual]

Create a listening socket and start accepting requests.

Blocks until a successful listening socket is created.

Exceptions:
std::runtime_errorIf listening on the given address fails.

Implemented in sevent::asiosocket::AsioFacade.

Definition at line 25 of file Facade.cc.

virtual void sevent::socket::Facade::sendEvent ( Session_ptr  session,
event::Event_ptr  event 
) [pure virtual]

Send an event using the given session, using local transfer if the session was created with this facade.

Shortcut for: 

 if(facade->isLocalSession(session)) {
     facade->invokeAllEventsHandler(session, event); // Invoke handler directly
 } else {
     session->sendEvent(event); // Serialize message, and send it via the session (socket communication)
 }

Implemented in sevent::asiosocket::AsioFacade.

void sevent::socket::Facade::sendEvent ( Address_ptr  address,
event::Event_ptr  event 
)

Create session with the server at the given address, and send the given event via the newly created session.

virtual void sevent::socket::Facade::setWorkerThreads ( unsigned  numberOfWorkerThreads,
workerThread_t  workerThreadHandler,
allEventsHandler_t  allEventsHandler 
) [pure virtual]
Parameters:
numberOfWorkerThreadsNumber of worker threads started.
allEventsHandlerCalled to handle incoming events.
workerThreadHandlerThis function is started in numberOfWorkerThreads separate threads.
